results.title: One hundred harvests
results.brief_description: Soundtrack currently not matched with picture. Quality violin music at begining, before the histroy of wheat farming in victoria is delivered through narration. It closes with a gentle orchestral piece that lasts around 60 seconds.

results.title: On the land (ii)
results.brief_description: Montage of colourful shots including a streetscape, livestock and grapepicking. Attractive illustrated title. Sound consists solely of a theme song. The music is upbeat, cheesey and evocative of television programmes of the 1970s and 1980s. Good countdown at begining, some numbers written as words, ie ‘six’ not ‘6’.
results.description: Montage of colourful shots including a streetscape, livestock and grapepicking. Attractive illustrated title. Sound consists solely of a theme song. The music is upbeat, cheesey and evocative of television programmes of the 1970s and 1980s. Good countdown at begining, some numbers written as words, ie ‘six’ not ‘6’.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.
results.description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.
description_for_label:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: Mice Milking
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this film contains scenes of animal restraint that some viewers may find disturbing.

This film, made by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, documents the process by which mice are milked in a laboratory at the Safe Research Farm in Werribee, for use in cancer research. The narrator explains that in mice, leukemia and mammary cancer are similar to cancer in humans and the virus is present in their milk. The mice milking machine in use in the film was developed by research officer Graeme Mein for demonstration in an open day at Werribee, based on those used by the National Cancer Institute, USA. The film shows laboratory technicians attaching a mouse to the machine and milking them.

results.title: Melons for Jam
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, is an instructional film on fruit preserving. Expert preserver Gwen McCrorey demonstrates the process for making melon jam in a domestic kitchen. This film is a fascinating insight into household kitchens and cooking in the 1950s, particularly before widespread international food import enabled greater fruit produce availability all year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.description: This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, is an instructional film on fruit preserving. Expert preserver Gwen McCrorey demonstrates the process for making melon jam in a domestic kitchen. This film is a fascinating insight into household kitchens and cooking in the 1950s, particularly before widespread international food import enabled greater fruit produce availability all year.
description_for_label: This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, is an instructional film on fruit preserving. Expert preserver Gwen McCrorey demonstrates the process for making melon jam in a domestic kitchen. This film is a fascinating insight into household kitchens and cooking in the 1950s, particularly before widespread international food import enabled greater fruit produce availability all year.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 8)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Shot of Yarra, looking towards Anderson St bridge.

Section 2. Royal Melbourne Show. Shots of various farm machinery on display. Crowds of people walking around enjoying themselves. Wood-chopping competition. Ladies riding horses, horse racing. More wood-chopping.
results.description:

results.title: Melbourne (no. 4)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Several shots of daffodils in a park. Nice colour, long shots.

Section 2. Shots in a park near the Yarra looking towards the city.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 3)
results.brief_description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 2)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Football match between Carlton and Richmond at Punt Road oval. Huge crowd. Good shots of football being played and the crowd reacting to the game.

Section 2. Two women at an observation point above the city.

Section 3. Shot of State Library with tram going past, shot of two statues in the city.

Section 4. Shots taken from behind St Paul’s cathederal looking down towards the Yarra, MCG and Flinders St train tracks.

Section 5. Shots of various statues and fountains around Melbourne.

Section 6. Shot from car driving along St Kilda Road, away from the city.

Section 7. Shots of city in the afternoon. Busy scene with Cars, buses, trams and people.

Section 8. Shot looking towards city from bank of Yarra. A man sits on a park bench in the foreground, surrounded by Seagulls.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 1)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Brief shots of the Shrine of Rememberance.

Section 2. Shots of the 1848 building from several angles.

Section 3. A cricket match at the MCG. Sparse crowd. Several angles and shots, lasts for three minutes.

Section 4. Luna Park at night. Brief shot of the entrance and the exterior of a dogem cars attraction.

Section 5. Houses in Melbourne; older and ‘new’. Brief.

Section 6. Various shots of parks and gardens. Brief.

Section 7. Spencer Street rail yards, shot from above. Brief.

Section 8. A few shots of the city, including trams and St. Paul’s cathederal.

Section 9. Woman in a park, admiring a flower bed. Good close-ups.

Section 10. Camera pans up from the Yarra to St Paul’s Cathederal/city in the distance. Nice shot.

Section 11. Good shots of the city from the Yarra.
